dojg.description: An adverb to indicate that one cannot make a definite statement about something due to lack of hard evidence.
dojg.meaning: I don't know why but; I cannot manage to; just; from what I gather; seem; no matter how ~; I gather that ~; for some reason

examples.japanese: (ksa).この文の意昧がどうもよく分からない。
examples.english: I tried, but I cannot understand the meaning  of this Japanese sentence very well.

examples.japanese: (ksb).鈴木さんはどうも京都大学に入りたいらしい。
examples.english: I gather that Mr. Suzuki wants to enter Kyoto  University.

examples.japanese: (ksc).あの先生の授業はどうも面白くない。
examples.english: I don't know why, but that instructor's class  is uninteresting.

examples.japanese: (a).このごろどうも体の詞子がよくないんです。
examples.english: I don't know why, but lately I don't feel  very good.

examples.japanese: (b).あの人の日本語はどうも聞きにくい。
examples.english: I don't know why, but his Japanese is hard to  listen to.

examples.japanese: (c).先生、この間題の意味がどうもつかめないんです。
examples.english: Professor, I can't manage to grasp the intent  of this problem.

examples.japanese: (d).こんな田舎に住むのはどうも不便だ。
examples.english: It is just inconvenient to live in such  countryside.

examples.japanese: (e).うちの子はテレビばかり見て、どうも本を読まない。
examples.english: I don't know why, but our kids are always  watching TV and do not read books.

examples.japanese: (f).あの先生はどうも厳しいようだ。
examples.english: That teacher seems strict to me.

examples.japanese: (g).ジョンは日本語を話すのは上手だが、読むのはどうも下手なようです。
examples.english: John is good at speaking Japanese but for  some reason he seems poor at reading it.

examples.japanese: (h).その男がどうも犯人に違いないと思っていたが、やっぱりそうだった。
examples.english: I gathered that he must be the one who did  it, and my guess was right.

examples.japanese: (i).父は症状からしてどうもがんになったらしい。
examples.english: Judging from the symptoms my father seems to  have cancer.

examples.japanese: (j).彼女が今朝電車の中で僕に言ったことがどうも気になった。
examples.english: What she said to me this morning in the train  somehow bothered me.

dojg.formation:
## 

- (i)どうも~
- {V /Adjective (い/な)} negative
- どうも話せない
- No matter how one tries, someone can’t talk
- どうも食べられない
- No matter how one tries, someone doesn’t eat
- どうもよくない
- I don’t know why but something isn’t good
- どうも上手じゃない
- I don’t know why, but someone is not good at something
- (ii)どうも~
- {V /Adjective い} informal {らしい/ようだ}
- どうも話す{らしい/ようだ}
- I gather that someone is going to talk
- どうも食べる{らしい/ようだ}
- I gather that someone is going to eat
- どうも高い{らしい/ようだ}
- I gather that something is expensive
- (iii)どうも~
- Adjective な stem {らしい/ようだ} or Adjective な stem だった{らしい/ようだ}
- どうも静か{らしい/ようだ}
- I gather that something is quiet
